net.sf.jga.fn
Class UnaryPredicate<T>

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.jga.fn.Functor<R>
      net.sf.jga.fn.UnaryFunctor<T,java.lang.Boolean>

All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, Visitable
Direct Known Subclasses:
All, AndUnary, Any, Between, CompareProperty, InstanceOf, LogicalNot, Match, OrUnary, UnaryNegate
Deprecated. not all functors that return boolean are predicates, but all predicates are functors that return boolean. In most cases where it matters, it is better to specify a boolean functor rather than a predicate. 

public abstract class UnaryPredicate<T>
extends UnaryFunctor<T,java.lang.Boolean>

A Predicate that takes one argument and returns a boolean result. The argument is of type T.
